result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

*Participate in any other community based services as determined by the VIP program director

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed without Prejudice 
*Reason:  Ms Shirek successfully completed the VIP Program as indicated in the attached letter from VIP Program Director Mike Champion dated September 15, 2016

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer J Shirek

defendant.name: Shirek, Jennifer J
defendant.address: 2271 County Road C, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: letter from Justiceworks dated 09/15/16 in re:  defendant has completed all of the conditiosn of her sentence to the Volunteers in Probation Program; recommended that defendant be discharged from the VIP program effective immediately

Defendant Jennifer J Shirek in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:32 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, parties are asking the Court to accept plea of Count 1.
Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.
Defendant was acccepted into the VIP program.

State addresses plea agreement.
Atty Sheets concurs, this is a joint recommendation.

Plea questionairee/Waiver of Rights form filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Atty Sheets on behalf of Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Clerk directed to WITHHOLD ENTRY of  Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Withold Entry
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Court will adopt recommendations.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Volunteers In Probation for a period of 9 Months
Conditions:
Perform 25 Hours of Community Service
Sign all releases of information for agencies and individuals to obtain copies of medical and other records to determine if she is substance free
Participate in any other community based services as determined by the VIP program director

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Authorization for Attorney to Appear and Act

$2,000 sig bond: Comply with any family court orders or child protection orders.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant Jennifer J Shirek in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  (Atty Redfield to file a withdrawal of counsel) 
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
BTC: $2,000 sig bond: Comply with any family court orders or child protection orders.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
